meanings.definition: A person who constantly complains or whines.
meanings.sent1: The bellyacher in our class always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a bellyacher and try to see the positive side of things.
meanings.sent3: The bellyacher at the party made everyone laugh with their constant complaints.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a bellyacher, always finding something to whine about.
meanings.sent5: The image of a bellyacher is someone with a perpetual frown and a never-ending list of grievances.

meanings.sent1: Stop bellyaching about the weather and let's enjoy the day.
meanings.sent2: She tends to bellyache whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The child bellyached all the way to the store about wanting a toy.
meanings.sent4: He bellyaches so much that no one wants to listen to him anymore.
meanings.sent5: The sound of someone bellyaching can be quite grating on the ears.
